intro: Epilobium tanguticum, commonly known as the Tangut willowherb, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau and adjacent regions. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to reddish-purple flowers, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Epilobium tanguticum plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora.
